channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: In Search of a Few Good Rock Stars
item.description: This major firm is located in Houston, Texas, but donâ€™t worry if youâ€™re not a local. They have a top-rate relocation program because finding talent matters to them. And what do they do once theyâ€™ve found the celebrities of the programming world? They take care of them, thatâ€™s what!

item.title: Wanted: Junior Perl Developer Ready to Move Up from the Bunny Hill
item.description: The client helps charities fund raise online and manages online payment systems for landlords, so youâ€™ll have the satisfaction of knowing youâ€™re contributing to the greater good. And if thatâ€™s not enough for you, did we mention the annual company ski trip AND the chance to work in the mountains near Lake Geneva for a week each year, all expenses paid? Giving back never felt so good!

item.title: All in the Family - Perl developer in Central Manchester
item.description: The client is a family business for the modern age, 100% owned by the founders and directors. Their mission is to match flatmates to flatshares because after all, you canâ€™t live at Mumâ€™s forever. Theyâ€™re looking for someone with a great attitude and a passion for collaborationâ€”basically, someone who plays nice with the other kids and shares their toys.

item.title: The Perl Conference 2020
item.description: June 23-27 2020 Houston, TX

item.title: DC-Baltimore Perlyglot Workshop (DCBPW) 2020
item.description: April 18-19 2020 Baltimore, MD

item.title: 22nd German Perl Workshop 2020

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Class, Role And Attribute Accessor in Raku
item.description: If a class attribute and a role method have the same name, which should be the one taking precedence? Which one should override the other? Should there be some kind of warning or error when there is such collision?

item.title: Leonardo Numbers
item.description: Ryan used Memoization to speed up the Leonardo number generation.

item.title: Attractive Numbers
item.description: Ryan introduced Wilson's Theorem whilst solving Attractive numbers.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 41: Attractive Numbers and Leonardo Numbers
item.description: Laurent used lazy list of Raku to solve Attractive number task. You will find plenty more magic like this.

item.title: PERL WEEKLY CHALLENGE â€“ 041
item.description: Javier used recursion to solve the Leonardo number task.

item.title: Attractive Leonardo Numbers with Raku
item.description: Arne's one-line Raku solution is the highlight. You don't want to miss it.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 041
item.description: A very interesting trick used in Attractive number task by Adam. Please do checkout.

item.title: Meet The Champion - Noud Aldenhoven
item.description: Please check out the short interview with the "Perl Weekly Challenge - 040" winner Noud Aldenhoven.

item.title: Raku Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 040
item.description: Raku Solutions Review by Laurent Rosenfeld.

item.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 040
item.description: Perl Solutions Review by Mohammad Anwar.

item.title: RECAP - Perl Weekly Challenge - 041
item.description: Recap of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 042
item.description: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: Goals for 2020
item.description: Frew does not seem to deal with Perl any more, but it is still interesting to see what personal goals he had last year and how he faired with his goals. It puts you in some perspective.

item.title: 20 best Perl questions at stackoverflow in 2019
10 best perl distributions created at 2019 (metacpan rating)
Annual Report - 2019
item.description: Detailed annual activity of Mohammad with graphs and what not. What did you this year? How much did you contribute to the world? Does this inspire you to do more interesting stuff?

item.title: How To Use TheSchwartz Perl Module (Part 2)
item.description: After a long break Steve wrote the second part of TheSchwartz.

item.title: Communication at the 36c3 Perl and Raku Assembly
item.description: How to talk about Perl and Raku so people might listen.

item.title: #441 - Welcome to 2020
item.description:
Hi,

welcome to the new year and to the new decade!

So what have you accomplish in the previous year and the previous decade? What are your plans for the new one? Send us a link to your report/resolution so we can be inspired!

But don't forget to enjoy your week as well!
